isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EVAPORATOR CORE

step1.para: Discharge the air conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITION- ING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE with R-134a in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove lower right instrument panel cover, heater-A/C assembly cover and drain tray. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, LOWER RIGHT INSTRUMENT PANEL, HEATER-A/C ASSEMBLY COVER AND DRAIN TRAY.
Remove air cleaner to turbo connection clamp.

note.para: Some models may not have an air cleaner in this location, but have other components (fuel heater, etc.) that must be removed.

step1.para: Remove air cleaner air restriction gauge.
Remove four (4) air cleaner mounting bracket fasteners from the dash panel and remove air cleaner ( Figure 29).
Remove expansion valve. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Remove.

From the engine side of the dash panel, remove the nuts and lockwashers that hold the evaporator in place ( Figure 30). One nut and washer is inside the sled runner. It will be necessary to use a magnet to remove the washer to prevent it from falling down inside the sled runner.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Remove Nuts and Lockwashers Holding Evaporator in Place

step1.para: From inside the cab, disconnect the electrical connector from the low pressure cut-off switch ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Disconnect Electrical Connector From Low Pressure Cut-Off Switch

step1.para: Pull evaporator out of the A/C unit and remove from the vehicle ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Pull Evaporator Out of A/C Unit

step1.para: Remove the low pressure cut-off switch.
Install a new O-ring, and lubricate the O-ring and the low pressure cut-off switch threads with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil.
Install the low pressure cut-off switch in the threaded opening in the evaporator low pressure tube ( Figure 33). Tighten to 7 to 15 ft-lbs. (9.5 to 20 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Install Low Pressure Cut-Off Switch in Threaded Opening

step1.para: Install the evaporator into the heater-A/C unit so that the connector end is in the dash panel seal opening ( Figure 34) and the two studs on the evaporator protrude through the dash panel ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Install Evaporator into Heater-A/C Unit

step1.para: Install a lockwasher and nut on both studs ( Figure 30) and tighten the nuts to 6 to 8 ft-lbs. (8 to 11 N•m).
Carefully install the capillary tube for the thermostatic control switch through the hole at the base of the evaporator opening in the A/C housing into the evaporator ( Figure 35).
Connect the electrical connector to the low pressure cut-off switch.
Install expansion valve. Refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Install.

note.para: Some models may not have an air cleaner in this location, but have other components (fuel heater, etc.) that must be installed.

step1.para: Re-install the air cleaner to the dash panel with the four (4) fasteners removed in Step 5 under EVAPORATOR CORE, Remove.
Install air cleaner restriction gauge.
Install air cleaner to turbo hose and clamp.
Evacuate and charge the Air Conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE with R-134a in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Check the A/C system operation.
Install lower right instrument panel cover, heater-A/C assembly cover and drain tray. Refer to LOWER RIGHT INSTRUMENT PANEL, HEATER-A/C ASSEMBLY COVER AND DRAIN TRAY.
